base.description: The base schema inherited by all other schemas

tag.description: Tag metadata applied to other objects

authuser.description: Extra user properties related to auth

userroles.description: Extra user properties for specifying roles

coursethemepreset.description: A reusable collection of theme settings

parentTheme.description: Name of the theme these settings should be applied to

courseasset.description: Metadata related to where an asset is used in a course

contentId.description: The ID for the content record that uses this asset

expiresAt.description: When the preview should be purged from the server

versions.description: Versions of framework and plugins used in the build

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Add tags by entering one or more words, separated with a comma (,)

extends.description: The parent role that this role should inherit scopes from

url.title: URL
url.description: If using an external asset, this should be the URL to the asset

createdAt.description: Date that the data was created

updatedAt.description: Date that the data was last modified

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Add tags by entering one or more words, separated with a comma (,)

createdAt.description: Date that the data was created

updatedAt.description: Date that the data was last modified

isLocalInstall.description: Whether the plugin has been installed locally (as opposed to with the CLI)

isAddedByDefault.description: Whether the plugin should be added by default for new courses

level.description: The priority level of the log message

module.description: Module responsible for creating the log

defaultplugins.description: Defines whether plugins should be added as default

isAddedByDefault.description: Whether the plugin should be added by default for new courses

config.description: The base schema inherited by all other schemas

_requireContentCompleted.title: Require all course content to be completed

_requireAssessmentCompleted.title: Require all assessments to be completed

_submitOnEveryAssessmentAttempt.title: Submit completion on every assessment attempt
_submitOnEveryAssessmentAttempt.description: If enabled and the course completion criteria is met, the completion status will be reported every time the assessment is completed (regardless of whether the user passes or fails)

_shouldSubmitScore.title: Submit score to LMS
_shouldSubmitScore.description: If enabled, the score attained in any assessment attempt will be reported (regardless of whether the user passes or fails)

_isSkipNavigationEnabled.title: Add link to skip navigation
_isSkipNavigationEnabled.description: Adds a link to the start of the page to allow assistive technology users to skip over the navigation and straight into to the page content

_ariaLevels.title: Default ARIA levels
_ariaLevels.description: Defines what value to assign to the aria-level attribute for the various elements of Adapt

_menuItem.title: Menu item
_menuItem.description: This will need to be changed to 3 if menu groups are being used and A11Y support is required

_options.title: Advanced options
_options.description: Optional object that can be used to customize the accessibility behaviour

_fixes.title: Miscellaneous fixes
_fixes.description: Optional object that can be used to customize the application of fixes

small.title: Small
small.description: Pixel width for the start of the small breakpoint, e.g. cellphones

medium.title: Medium
medium.description: Pixel width for the start of the medium breakpoint, e.g. tablet devices

large.title: Large
large.description: Pixel width for the start of the large breakpoint, e.g. laptop/desktop computers

xlarge.title: Extra Large
xlarge.description: Pixel width for the start of the extra large breakpoint, e.g. hd laptop/desktop computers

_generateSourcemap.title: Generate source maps
_generateSourcemap.description: Allows the course JavaScript & CSS to be debugged via the browser's developer tools

_forceRouteLocking.title: Enforce route locking
_forceRouteLocking.description: If locking is enabled, this setting prevents navigating to locked routes

_disableAnimationFor.title: Disable animation on selectors
_disableAnimationFor.description: Allows you to disable some animations (e.g. the drawer close animation) on platform(s) where they are not performing well, using CSS selectors to target the relevant platform(s) via the classes on the HTML element

_limitToSelector.title: Limit to selector
_limitToSelector.description: CSS selector to match against the HTML element when determining whether this should be active or not

build.title: Support for setting the course build type

strictMode.title: Use strict mode?
strictMode.description: Strict mode improves performance by tightly restricting the declaration of variables inside code blocks and closures which may cause some older code to stop working. Please leave this at true unless you are experiencing issue with old plugins or third party libraries.

targets.title: Supported browsers override
targets.description: Set the browsers that are supported. Overwrites the framework defaults if not empty. Current defaults are: 'last 2 chrome versions, last 2 firefox versions, last 2 safari versions, last 2 edge versions, last 2 ios_saf versions, last 2 and_chr versions, firefox esr'

createdAt.description: Date that the data was created

updatedAt.description: Date that the data was last modified

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Add tags by entering one or more words, separated with a comma (,)

content.description: The base schema inherited by all other schemas

_friendlyId.title: Friendly id
_friendlyId.description: A human-readable ID for this content object which will replace the standard _id field on course build (useful in instances where the _id must be specified in the config of an extension). Must be unique to this course.

displayTitle.title: Display title
displayTitle.description: When viewing an element - this is the title that will be displayed on the page

_classes.title: Custom classes
_classes.description: Used to style or manipulate the look and feel of this element. These are predefined in the theme or added in Project Settings > Custom CSS/Less code

_isOptional.title: Make this element optional
_isOptional.description: An optional element does not have to be completed, nor do any of the elements contained within it

_isAvailable.title: Make this element available
_isAvailable.description: Controls whether this element and its contents are available in the course or not

_isHidden.title: Hide this element
_isHidden.description: Enabling this is equivalent to applying the CSS 'display:none' to the element

_isVisible.title: Make this element visible
_isVisible.description: Disabling this is equivalent to applying the CSS 'visibility:hidden' to the element

_ariaLevel.title: Custom ARIA level
_ariaLevel.description: If you need to override the default element ARIA level (as defined in Configuration Settings), set this to any number greater than 0

_onScreen.title: Animation classes
_onScreen.description: These settings allow you to attach classes to the element when it is within the browser's viewport; helpful for running CSS-based animations on elements as they scroll into view

_isEnabled.title: Add classes when this element is in view

_classes.title: Classes
_classes.description: The CSS class(es) to add to the element

_percentInviewVertical.title: Percent in view
_percentInviewVertical.description: Controls what percentage of the element's height needs to be in the viewport in order for the CSS class(es) to be added

createdAt.description: Date that the data was created

updatedAt.description: Date that the data was last modified

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Add tags by entering one or more words, separated with a comma (,)

failedLoginAttempts.description: The number of failed login attempts

_requireCompletionOf.title: Number of blocks required for completion
_requireCompletionOf.description: The number of blocks within this article the learner must complete in order for this article to be set as completed. A value of -1 requires all of them to be completed

_requireCompletionOf.description: The number of components within this block the learner must complete in order for this block to be set as completed. A value of -1 requires all of them to be completed

tags.description: Add tags by entering one or more words, separated with a comma (,)

_isResetOnRevisit.title: Reset state on revisit
_isResetOnRevisit.description: Controls whether this component will be reset when the learner leaves the page then returns to it. The 'soft' setting will reset the component to allow the learner to attempt it again, but will not require them to do so; whereas the 'hard' setting will require them to do so. The default (false) will not cause the component to be reset

_disableAccessibilityState.title: Disable completion ARIA label
_disableAccessibilityState.description: Controls whether the user can tab to a hidden label that describes the completion state of the component

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Add tags by entering one or more words, separated with a comma (,)

subtitle.title: Subtitle
subtitle.description: When viewing a menu/page - this is the subtitle that will be displayed on the menu/page

pageBody.title: Custom page body
pageBody.description: If set, this text will be shown instead of the body text when this page is viewed

_htmlClasses.title: Custom HTML classes
_htmlClasses.description: If set, this CSS class/es will be applied to the <html> element whenever this is the active page in the course. These are predefined in the theme or added in Project Settings > Custom CSS/Less code

alt.title: Alternative text
alt.description: A description of the image; required when it has meaning that must be conveyed to the learner. For 'decorative' images, leave this blank

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Indicates how long this page or section should take to complete

_lockedBy.title: Elements to complete before this is unlocked
_lockedBy.description: If the course is using a 'custom' menu lock type, this should contain the unique ID of the item(s) which must be completed before this is unlocked

_lockType.title: Menu lock type
_lockType.description: Defines which (if any) locking mechanism will be used. To be used only on submenus

_requireCompletionOf.title: Number of articles required for completion
_requireCompletionOf.description: The number of articles within this page the learner must complete in order for this page to be set as completed. A value of -1 requires all of them to be completed

course.description: The base schema inherited by all other schemas

_friendlyId.title: Friendly id
_friendlyId.description: A human-readable ID for this content object which will replace the standard _id field on course build (useful in instances where the _id must be specified in the config of an extension). Must be unique to this course.

displayTitle.title: Display title
displayTitle.description: When viewing an element - this is the title that will be displayed on the page

_classes.title: Custom classes
_classes.description: Used to style or manipulate the look and feel of this element. These are predefined in the theme or added in Project Settings > Custom CSS/Less code

_isOptional.title: Make this element optional
_isOptional.description: An optional element does not have to be completed, nor do any of the elements contained within it

_isAvailable.title: Make this element available
_isAvailable.description: Controls whether this element and its contents are available in the course or not

_isHidden.title: Hide this element
_isHidden.description: Enabling this is equivalent to applying the CSS 'display:none' to the element

_isVisible.title: Make this element visible
_isVisible.description: Disabling this is equivalent to applying the CSS 'visibility:hidden' to the element

_ariaLevel.title: Custom ARIA level
_ariaLevel.description: If you need to override the default element ARIA level (as defined in Configuration Settings), set this to any number greater than 0

_onScreen.title: Animation classes
_onScreen.description: These settings allow you to attach classes to the element when it is within the browser's viewport; helpful for running CSS-based animations on elements as they scroll into view

createdAt.description: Date that the data was created

updatedAt.description: Date that the data was last modified

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Add tags to your course by entering one or more words, separated with a comma (,)

heroImage.title: Preview image
heroImage.description: The image that will be shown in the dashboard for this course

subtitle.title: Subtitle
subtitle.description: This is the subtitle that will be displayed on the course's main menu

description.title: Description
description.description: This will be added to the course's manifest file metadata. It is not (currently) displayed anywhere within the course

_htmlClasses.title: Custom HTML classes
_htmlClasses.description: If set, this class will be applied to the <html> element when the top-level menu in the course is displayed. These are predefined in the theme or added in Custom CSS/Less code

_start.title: Start settings
_start.description: The start settings allow you to control which page is rendered when a course loads, potentially bypassing the menu

_isEnabled.title: Route to custom start page on course load

_skipIfComplete.title: Skip page if complete
_skipIfComplete.description: If enabled, the page will not be selected as the first page if it has been already viewed/completed

_className.title: Limit to classes
_className.description: Optional comma-separated list of class names which will be used to select this start page

_force.title: Always route to start page
_force.description: If enabled, the routing will be forced to the appropriate start page, regardless of the URL

_isMenuDisabled.title: Disable menu
_isMenuDisabled.description: Allows you to prevent the user from seeing - or navigating to - the main menu

_navOrder.title: Navigation bar order
_navOrder.description: Determines the order in which the object is displayed in the navigation bar. Negative numbers (e.g. -100) are left-aligned. Positive numbers (e.g. 100) are right-aligned.

_navOrder.title: Navigation bar order
_navOrder.description: Determines the order in which the object is displayed in the navigation bar. Negative numbers (e.g. -100) are left-aligned. Positive numbers (e.g. 100) are right-aligned.

_navOrder.title: Navigation bar order
_navOrder.description: Determines the order in which the object is displayed in the navigation bar. Negative numbers (e.g. -100) are left-aligned. Positive numbers (e.g. 100) are right-aligned.

_navOrder.title: Navigation bar order
_navOrder.description: Determines the order in which the object is displayed in the navigation bar. Negative numbers (e.g. -100) are left-aligned. Positive numbers (e.g. 100) are right-aligned.

disabledAriaLabel.title: Disabled ARIA label
disabledAriaLabel.default: This button is disabled at the moment

_navigation.title: Navigation settings
_navigation.description: The navigation settings allow you to control the behaviour of the navigation bar.

_navigationAlignment.title: Navigation alignment
_navigationAlignment.description: The CSS selector that determines where the navigation bar is displayed. Must be a selector targeting the HTML element.

_showLabelAtWidth.title: Show label at this breakpoint and higher
_showLabelAtWidth.description: When the user's browser window is at least this wide, the labels will be shown. Options refer to the standard Adapt breakpoints. The 'any' option will show the label at any size.

_labelPosition.title: Label position
_labelPosition.description: Where to show the label in relation to the button icons

_requireCompletionOf.title: Number of pages/submenus required for completion
_requireCompletionOf.description: The number of content objects within this course the learner must complete in order for this course to be set as completed. A value of -1 requires all of them to be completed

_isShared.title: Share with all users
_isShared.description: Defines whether this course will be editable by all users

_shareWithUsers.title: Share with specific users
_shareWithUsers.description: Defines which individual users are able to edit this course

_lockType.title: Menu lock type
_lockType.description: Defines which (if any) locking mechanism will be used for menu items

customStyle.title: Custom CSS/Less code
customStyle.description: Add any custom CSS or valid Less code here
